Description: Fragment of wool cloth, mainly dark brown but with a multi-coloured band and undyed/cream wool; Weft-faced plain weave and extended plain weave; Remains of double row of twining in red and cream, probably lower extremity of the cloth; Colour in band arranged symmetrically, from centre out=38 picks yellow, 6 green, 5 brown, 5 cream, 7 dark blue, 48 dark red, 6 dark blue, 4 or 6 cream; Warp: S spun wool, c.9tpc; Weft: S spun wool, c.20tpc in plain area and c.40tpc in band; Edges: two selvedges with two groups of warp thread and extra circuits of main weft, the long edges have part of a chain stitch with yellow and red wool - damaged, other edges torn.
Curator's comments: Unreg 87.; Sand or salt crystals on the stripes; Diagnostic of warp-weighted loom (warp groups of 1:2:1:2), broken ends of dropped threads visible; Multiple bands but not on grouped threads are on EA72434 and EA72438; Probably from a garment; Not sure if brown is dyed or pigment, probably pigmented; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (21.5.1991).
Condition: Fair; Dirty and crumpled but colour good in areas
